mapper.select: select pdid, p_uid, product_name, amount, expire_time, start_time, remark, uid as p_uid, uname from pd inner join purchaser p on pd.p_uid = p.uid where expire_time > now() limit #{size} offset #{offset}
select count(*) from pd where expire_time > now()
mapper.insert: insert into quote (p_id, v_uid, amount, total_price, remark) values (#{p_id}, #{v_uid}, #{amount}, #{total_price}, #{remark})
mapper.select: select amount, p_id, qid, remark, total_price, v_uid, uname, product_name from (select amount, p_id, qid, remark, total_price, v_uid from quote where v_uid = #{v_uid}) as t1 inner join (select pdid, p_uid, p.uname, pd.product_name from pd inner join purchaser p on pd.p_uid = p.uid) as t2 on t1.p_id = t2.pdid where qid not in (select qid from processing) limit #{size} offset #{offset}

select count(*) from (select amount, p_id, qid, remark, total_price, v_uid from quote where v_uid = #{v_uid}) as t1 inner join (select pdid, p_uid, p.uname, pd.product_name from pd inner join purchaser p on pd.p_uid = p.uid) as t2 on t1.p_id = t2.pdid where qid not in (select qid from processing)

select pid, qid, pdid, status, start_time, p_uid, p_name, product_name, amount, total_price, cname, cpath, cexpire_time, remark from processing where v_uid = #{v_uid} and status > 0 and 8 > processing.status limit #{size} offset #{offset}
select count(*) from processing where v_uid = #{v_uid} and status > 0 and 8 > processing.status
select uid, uname, email, rate, rate_num from purchaser where uid = #{uid} limit 1
mapper.update: update procurement set cname = #{filename}, cpath = #{path}, cexpire_time = #{expire_time}, status = 3, csize = #{file_size} where pid = #{pid}
mapper.delete: delete from procurement where pid = #{pid} and status = 2
mapper.select: select p_uid from processing where pid = #{pid} and status > 0 and 8 > processing.status
mapper.update: update purchaser set rate = (rate * rate_num + #{rate}) / (rate_num + 1), rate_num = rate_num + 1 where uid = #{uid}
mapper.select: select rate from vendor where uid = #{uid} limit 1

select t2.label as `label`, coalesce(counts, 0) as `count` from (select cast(t.start_time as DATE) as label, count(*) as counts from (select * from pd where start_time > date_sub(now(), INTERVAL 7 DAY) and expire_time > now()) as t group by day(t.start_time)) as t1 right join (select DATE_SUB(curdate(), INTERVAL 0 DAY) label union select DATE_SUB(curdate(), INTERVAL 1 DAY) label union select DATE_SUB(curdate(), INTERVAL 2 DAY) label2 union select DATE_SUB(curdate(), INTERVAL 3 DAY) label3 union select DATE_SUB(curdate(), INTERVAL 4 DAY) label4 union select DATE_SUB(curdate(), INTERVAL 5 DAY) label5 union select DATE_SUB(curdate(), INTERVAL 6 DAY) label6) as t2 on t1.label = t2.label order by label

select sum(if(status = 1, 1, 0)) as `one`, sum(if(status = 2, 1, 0)) as `two`, sum(if(status = 3, 1, 0)) as `three`, sum(if(status = 4, 1, 0)) as `four`, sum(if(status = 5, 1, 0)) as `five`, sum(if(status = 6, 1, 0)) as `six`, sum(if(status = 7, 1, 0)) as `seven`, sum(if(status > 7 or 1 > processing.status, 1, 0)) as `finished` from processing where v_uid = #{v_uid}
select pid, qid, pdid, status, start_time, p_uid, p_name, product_name, amount, total_price, cname, cpath, cexpire_time, remark from processing where v_uid = #{v_uid} and status in (2, 4, 7) limit 6
select pdid, product_name, amount, expire_time, start_time, remark, uid as p_uid, uname from pd inner join purchaser p on pd.p_uid = p.uid where expire_time > now() order by start_time DESC limit 6
